title: The Ossians
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He thought of the picturesque view from the Scott Monument back in Edinburgh and how the city attracted swarms of tourists, even in winter, so that it didn't seem to have any character of its own any more. He also thought of the shitty, schemie parts of the city – Craigmillar, Wester Hailes, Sighthill – and decided that he really had no idea whether Scotland was a beautiful place or not.
